text: Birkir Bjarnason (born on 27 May 1988 in Akureyri, Iceland) is an Icelandic professional footballer who plays as a central midfielder. He currently plays for the Swiss club of FC Basel and the Iceland national team. In his homeland he is nicknamed Thor. He has also played for Viking FK, FK Bodø/Glimt, Standard Liège, Delfino Pescara 1936 and Sampdoria. He won the Swiss Super League with Basel in 2016. He was included in Iceland's squad for the UEFA Euro 2016. On 14 June 2016, he scored Iceland's first goal at a major tournament. It was against Portugal, and the game ended in a draw. == Statistics == === International goals === # Date Location Opponent Score Result Competition 27 May 2012 Valenciennes, France Friendly 12 October 2012 Tirana, Albania 2014 FIFA World Cup qualification 7 June 2013 Reykjavík, Iceland 2014 FIFA World Cup qualification 10 September 2013 Reykjavík, Iceland 2014 FIFA World Cup qualification 28 March 2015 Nur-Sultan, Kazakhstan UEFA Euro 2016 qualifying 28 March 2015 Nur-Sultan, Kazakhstan UEFA Euro 2016 qualifying 14 June 2016 Saint-Étienne, France UEFA Euro 2016 3 July 2016 Saint-Denis, France UEFA Euro 2016 == References == == Other websites == *KSI profile *Profile on the Swiss Football League homepage *Profile at Viking Category:1988 births Category:Living people Category:Icelandic footballers Category:UEFA Euro 2016 players
